title: Bramshill Forest Walking Route

images.title: Brendan and Ruth McCartney / Bramshill Forest
images.caption: Bramshill Forest. A quiet lane looking north past Yew Tree Cottage.

images.title: Brendan and Ruth McCartney / Bramshill
images.caption: Looking west on the minor road to the south of the square. The rest of the square to the north is a mixture of dense forest and open heathland.

images.title: Colin Bates / Bramshill Plantation
images.caption: Bramshill Plantation - densely planted Fir, with deciduous trees adging the thoroughfares through the plantation.

images.title: Diane Sambrook / Long Pond in Bramshill Plantation
images.caption: Reflections on the pretty Long Pond in the Bramshill Plantation

images.title: don cload / Footpath through Bramshill Plantation
images.caption: Footpath through Bramshill Plantation The public footpath crosses Bramshill Plantation in a zigzag line, this is one of the straight sections.

description: This circular walk takes you around the pretty Bramshill Forest, near Eversley in Hampshire. The walk makes use of the Three Castles Path and various woodland trails, taking you through Warren Heath, Hazeley Heath and Heath Warren Wood. You'll pass a number of pretty streams and tranquil ponds on the way. Look out for wildlife including deer and various woodland birds as you make your way along the paths. If you'd like to continue your walking in the area then you could head to the nearby Bracknell Forest or Wellington Country Park where you'll find miles of walking trails.
